update.description:
The previous behavior loads all the render engine plugins as soon as ign-rendering is launched. The changes make sure that the render engine is only loaded if they are requested \(e.g. through `engine("engine_name")`\)

This more efficient and also necessary as ogre1 and ogre2 can not be loaded at the same time.
update.title: Load render engines on demand

content.raw:
calling this function after one of these has been initialized will set all these to `nullptr`

is that dangerous? should we just set it to `nullptr` if the map is empty at that key?
content.html:
calling this function after one of these has been initialized will set all these to nullptr

is that dangerous? should we just set it to nullptr if the map is empty at that key?

content.raw: great thanks. I just checked ogre 1.10 installation on Windows and it also doesn't have the `lib` prefix so I think it’s probably true for 2.x and we could just remove it
content.html: great thanks. I just checked ogre 1.10 installation on Windows and it also doesn't have the lib prefix so I think it’s probably true for 2.x and we could just remove it

content.raw:
almost there; I just needed to remove the `lib` prefix for apple and now it's working (47ba416e7335)

we could consider removing the `prefix` variable entirely since it's not used right now (not sure if it will be needed for windows)
content.html:
almost there; I just needed to remove the lib prefix for apple and now it's working (47ba416e7335)

we could consider removing the prefix variable entirely since it's not used right now (not sure if it will be needed for windows)

content.raw: I made some changes in [2c135ab](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/2c135ab2d439dde20a1c35728be328d04bdaf95a) to make ign-rendering look into osx’s ogre plugin installation directory. Hopefully that’ll make a difference

content.raw: and as I said before, the OgreMeshTool has the same problem
content.html: and as I said before, the OgreMeshTool has the same problem

content.raw:
it's specifically having trouble loading plugins.cfg

https://gist.github.com/scpeters/3acbe3fb28e7779c44ab83c283860daa
content.html:
it's specifically having trouble loading plugins.cfg

https://gist.github.com/scpeters/3acbe3fb28e7779c44ab83c283860daa

content.raw: mm weird. The code in the [Ogre2RenderEngine::CreateRenderSystem](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/6b707dde514a5b2e0714c2e2dcce2bb65c4dcec4/ogre2/src/Ogre2RenderEngine.cc#lines-437) function is supposed to be setting the configurations instead of having ogre to load a cfg script from file.  Could you upload the ogre2.log to a gist and I’ll see if I make spot anything unusual?
content.html: mm weird. The code in the Ogre2RenderEngine::CreateRenderSystem function is supposed to be setting the configurations instead of having ogre to load a cfg script from file. Could you upload the ogre2.log to a gist and I’ll see if I make spot anything unusual?

content.raw:
yeah, now I remember. ogre has trouble finding the .cfg files (which the homebrew formula installs to `share/OGRE/cfg` instead of the default location in `bin`). I had to add this patch in order for the OgreMeshTool to execute successful in the homebrew formula test

* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ogre2.1.rb#L104-L125

I was able to run the `UNIT_RenderingIface_TEST` test successfully with a current working directory of `/usr/local/share/OGRE/cfg`

so that's the problem, but I'm not sure the right way to fix it.
content.html:
yeah, now I remember. ogre has trouble finding the .cfg files (which the homebrew formula installs to share/OGRE/cfg instead of the default location in bin). I had to add this patch in order for the OgreMeshTool to execute successful in the homebrew formula test

  • https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ogre2.1.rb#L104-L125

I was able to run the UNIT_RenderingIface_TEST test successfully with a current working directory of /usr/local/share/OGRE/cfg

so that's the problem, but I'm not sure the right way to fix it.

content.raw: thanks, there's some errors there that may be related to the homebrew bottle / formula (I remember seeing something similar while writing the homebrew test). I'll take a look at that and get back to you
content.html: thanks, there's some errors there that may be related to the homebrew bottle / formula (I remember seeing something similar while writing the homebrew test). I'll take a look at that and get back to you

content.raw: could you see if there are outputs generated in `~/.ignition/rendering/ogre2.log`? It could be that we have to use Metal instead of OpenGL3\+ on mac
content.html: could you see if there are outputs generated in ~/.ignition/rendering/ogre2.log? It could be that we have to use Metal instead of OpenGL3+ on mac
